channel.title: davewiner tweets

item.description: @itraor Not true. I had a meeting with @jack when Twitter was still very small and he told me what he wanted to do.
item.source:markdown: @itraor Not true. I had a meeting with @jack when Twitter was still very small and he told me what he wanted to do.

item.description: Why it would be so hard to obscure phone data in a post-Roe world. https://t.co/DmncT909o1
item.source:markdown: Why it would be so hard to obscure phone data in a post-Roe world. https://t.co/DmncT909o1

item.description:
@stewartbrand I think of myself as a developer, because there's much more to what I do than programming.

I am not an engineer, my degrees are in math and computer science -- not engineering.

People in the engineering school (UW-Madison) made sure we didn't call ourselves engineers. ;-)
Carmelo Anthony has been linked to the Brooklyn Nets. https://t.co/jTPCbcb2kF
item.source:markdown: Carmelo Anthony has been linked to the Brooklyn Nets. https://t.co/jTPCbcb2kF

item.description: The MAGA-Largo Affidavit shows Trump stashed top secrets, is in big trouble. https://t.co/81jizElrXn

item.source:markdown: Coverage of Ron DeSantis shows the media has learned nothing from Trump. https://t.co/XLUfbERUX3

item.description:
Jack Dorsey says his biggest regret is that Twitter was a company at all. https://t.co/Dlj7rwjNAl

In 2022 we could make something Twitter-like with RSS.
item.source:markdown:
Jack Dorsey says his biggest regret is that Twitter was a company at all. https://t.co/Dlj7rwjNAl
In 2022 we could make something Twitter-like with RSS.

item.description:
Calling a person toxic is really bad.

It's the kind of thing people who run death camps say about the people they put in death camps.

It's a trigger for me -- as a child of Holocaust survivors.

There aren't many insults I'll complain about, but that's one of them.
item.source:markdown:
Calling a person toxic is really bad.
It's the kind of thing people who run death camps say about the people they put in death camps.
It's a trigger for me -- as a child of Holocaust survivors.
There aren't many insults I'll complain about, but that's one of them.

item.description: @KenSmith and we have forgotten to thank you for that.
item.source:markdown: @KenSmith and we have forgotten to thank you for that.

item.description:
@whengoodenough I should’ve had that as an option.

I was turned down for being overqualified too, but in my case it was a good thing. My degree was worth more than I understood.
item.source:markdown:
@whengoodenough I should’ve had that as an option.
I was turned down for being overqualified too, but in my case it was a good thing. My degree was worth more than I understood.

item.description: If you have a college degree, how was it paid for?
item.source:markdown: If you have a college degree, how was it paid for?

item.description:
BTW the feeds that https://t.co/u6ZwqwJBxG manages are public.

feeds are public things.

as is your twitter timeline.

somehow someone got the idea that the feed is a private thing.

people should read the docs, or if in doubt -- ask.

don't make stuff up.
item.source:markdown:
BTW the feeds that https://t.co/u6ZwqwJBxG manages are public.
feeds are public things.
as is your twitter timeline.
somehow someone got the idea that the feed is a private thing.
people should read the docs, or if in doubt -- ask.
don't make stuff up.

item.description: To reporters working on the whistleblower re Twitter, please talk with @daphnehk (below) -- she appears to be an expert on this subject and has the credentials to back it up. https://t.co/SqTUh8tJhN

item.description:
A question for developers and users of feed readers.

Does your reader software strip HTML from feed items?

Or does all the markup come through?

Devs can contact me directly if you like.
item.source:markdown:
A question for developers and users of feed readers.
Does your reader software strip HTML from feed items?
Or does all the markup come through?
Devs can contact me directly if you like.

item.description: @gregggonsalves @KatherineJWu Wish I could read it, but the paywall says no.
